review_title: Does not Honor FMLA time during spouses Cancer crisis
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Kingman, AZ
pros: Teamwork was top notch and enjoyed working with wonderful team-mates
cons: Don't have a Crisis in your life, as this company does not Honor FMLA,! My spouse had cancer and I was forced to quit! I do not recommend this company, they do not consider your family important, I found out from many other medical professionals after the fact, they also had something similar happen to them had to quit and moved away.

cons: Unfair point systems Horrible pay

pros: Great supervisors. Good people mostly you work with.

pros: Nothing to say here oh well

pros: I loved working in the outpatient laboratory as a licensed phlebotomy technician. The team was amazing and worked really hard to keep an outstanding 5star record. The patients were very sweet and kind as well. They loved visiting our lab. I honestly miss working in a hospital environment and being a servant. I really enjoyed serving the Kingman community as their phlebotomist technician!!
cons: The new hirers I trained were inexperienced, not licensed or certified, made $1-$5 more in hourly pay then the phlebotomy technicians who had been working there for a while. The manager and director had no lab experience and we’re trying to run the lab department. Ended up not being as enjoyable to work there.

review_title: Pay sucks. Benefits are good. ER has good support staff.
pros: Benefits are good. Support staff for ER is good.
cons: Pay is terrible. Upper management is patronizing.

pros: The hospital is growing and adding much needed services. The hospital has a partnership with Mayo Clinic

review_title: Very corrupt company.  Run the other way while you still have your humanity and can think for yourself.
pros: The staff is wonderful and truly care. Truly talented and unappreciated or cared for.  So many great people have come and gone because of the treatment at this place.
cons:
Management is corrupt. Especially the radiology department. You have no right to express your thoughts, feelings, ideas, and family life. You will be degraded and expected to do their bidding without the ability to defend yourself or treated fairly.  You will be a slave to their will and don't expect to be asked or given a choice. Your family time will be sacrificed. Your self esteem and pride will be thrown in the gutter. 
There is nothing in this town to do, especially for young people. 
Bad place for minorities also. I wouldn't recommend this place to my enemy either.

pros: The community is underserved and there is a great need for medical care.
cons: Nursing does not abide by EBP, and when asked why, a common response is, "This is the way we have always done it."  If you try to counter with with reason and research, you are ostracized.  I have seen multiple nurses, and a manager, ran off a unit or out of the hospital due to bullying by other nurses and a unit secretary.  There is a huge disconnect between the community and the hospital.

review_title: If the other hospital was still here, I would NOT go anywhere near this place
pros: None that I am aware of - while some say the benefits are great, it must have been before 2014....employees are now footing much of their benefit bills.  It's like Walmart all over again.  And, while I normally root for non-profits, I certainly don't root for this one.
cons: Lousy pay, apply for 20+ jobs yet all of them say that you are not as qualified as the next person (even when the qualifications are pretty basic).  How can they determine that I am not qualified for the position within 30 minutes of me applying online?  How does that work exactly???

review_title: Quickly losing its focus on the mission and vision of the organization.
pros: All in all, the people at KRMC are here to do whats right. Amazing coworkers. Good pay and benefits with limited hassle. Great Human Resources department.
cons: The training is limited. The basic communication regarding when, where, and how, to perform duties is missing. Limited resources for job support. Senior Management is a lacking in multiple areas.

pros: The team ethic in the ICU is phenomenal. This includes physicians, RTs, dietitians, pharmacists, case managers, and the amazing CNAs/LNAs. The facility hires new grads and has a nurse residency program.
cons: The EMR is cumbersome, not well built, and prone to hiccups. There is a great deal of pressure to use scripted comments in an effort to raise “scores”.  The free coffee that is an employee benefit is really bad.

pros:
Great physicians and ICU nurses. 
Ability to have personal interaction with the physicians regarding patient care
cons:
From administration, HR to department management needs to be replaced.
Management in some departments are allowed to speak to the therapist as if they are trash.  Allowing some to jeopardize the safety of patients and have no actions taken against them.

pros: got paid well but suffered for the extra money.  Learned how bad it can be on the other side of the fence.
cons: KRMC is the worst run hospital i have ever seen.  Upper management like Ryan Kennedy have completely destroyed the hospital and its reputation in my opinion.  I have never believed in Unions until i worked for KRMC.  They do not respect people and do some crazy crazy stuff. IF you are a traveler and making more that 45 an hour i would do a tour of duty and move on but full time employment is not a good deal.

pros: Schedules where great. Pay was good. Benefits were Awsome.
cons: The management was horrible and HR wasn't much better.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Kingman, AZ
pros: enjoyed going to different offices every day. Seeing all kinds of people, enjoying the different co-workers.
cons: always someone in management wanting to do things different than the other offices. I worked for the hospital and went to 14 different medical offices when one of their employees had to be out. Always made it through and went home smiling.

pros: It was a great working environment. Loved and miss it
cons: I developed some health issues I needed to sort out and my manager suggested I'll do short term disability, and then let me go before it ran out.

cons: Hard to get in the door unless you know someone. If you are negated by one many times that closes the door for you until there is a turn over of management.

pros: Real good people.. nice job.
